channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipped small furniture items, 24th November
item.description:
On footpath 114. Next to Queens Gardens. The fly tipped items are still there. Drive down the bottom of Queens Avenue. It’s the park side of the wall.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lownds Court, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water bubbling up through pavement, 24th November
item.description:
Please can the pavement be inspected as water has been leaking out of the pavement for a couple of weeks and it’s going to be very dangerous if it freezes over. There’s a small Thames Water inspection cover on the pavement. This is where the water is pouring out of.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Murray Avenue, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement flooding, 24th November
item.description:
Whenever there is rain the pavement floods and has nowhere to drain to.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Streatham Hill, Streatham, Greater London

item.title: Hardcore spilt on Rafford Way towards The Chase, 24th November
item.description:
Building works have nearly finished as The Y Buildings. Unfortunately they have spilt hard core on the road in Rafford Way and The Chase. Please can this be swept up before someone falls or a cyclist/motorcyclist crashes. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rafford Way, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pigeon excrement on the pavement /side walk, 24th November
item.description:
There are pigeons using this satellite dish as a place to nest at night and excretes on the side walk/ pavement area of dutton house on mere road, SE2 9AD. This is very unsightly and is currently causing a health and safety issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southmere Drive, Greater London

item.title: Vehicle access blocked to Bromley Palace Park, 24th November
item.description:
Galliard Homes have blocked the vehicle access to Bromley Palace Park. This means that EMERGENCY VEHICLES, Bromley Council, IdVerde and Veolia cannot get into the park for emergencies, general maintenance or emptying the bins.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, Greater London

item.title: Constant fly tipping outside bus station second report, 24th November
item.description:

item.title: 8 Prince Albert Road NW1 7SR Camden Town, 24th November
item.description:
Subject: Water flooding on pavement when it rains Hello, There is a recurring water flooding problem on the pavement at this location. Whenever it rains, a large amount of water collects here and the pavement becomes flooded. This makes it difficult and unsafe for pedestrians to walk. Photo is attached for reference. Could the council please inspect and fix the drainage or pavement so the water can flow properly? Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Outer Circle, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The pavement works obstruction, 24th November
item.description:
This obstruction was put across our driveway more than a week ago. Without any notification. This has now made access to my driveway difficult. I have already had a scratch as a direct result of this obstruction. Please advise how may I contact you to explain this with all the details. This obstruction still sits here with no clear date for removal. I am holding Bromley council responsible for all inconveniences and damages.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avondale Road, Sundridge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White paint on the pavement and on the road outside 175, 24th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bedonwell Road, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Block drains for nearly 10 years, 24th November
item.description:
Everytime we get a large amount of rain these gullies overflow. This has been a problem for years and years. Probably at least 10 if not more. There is clearly something wrong with the sewer system so I suggest working with the Thames Water to iron out what is causing it and fix it!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Georges Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal parking sign added by residents, 24th November
item.description:
Someone has took it upon themselves to reserve all the parking spots for these residents only and when you park there they say council have reserved for them and block you in. Please take sign down and put a sign saying it’s for everybody use Thankyou

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Whimbrel Close, Thamesmead

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Recycling Bins not emptied or serviced, 24th November
item.description:
The problem with these recycling bins not being emptied continues. Lately I have seen the public recycling bins at Sainsbury's site and the recycling bins at The Crescent Orpington, near Green Street Green, being taken away and replaced. However here at Magpie Hall Lane these bins are just left to rot into a deplorable mess. This has been going on for a long time. Due to Waldo Road being closed for refurbishment has made the situation worse, vans, cars etc pull up and dump rubbish which Bromley do take away. However the large green bins are just left. In July I wrote to the Bromley's Environmental Health Dept who only sent an automatic receipt of email. Can someone look into this please. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Magpie Hall Lane, Bromley Common, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several trash bags, torn, trash lying around, 24th November
item.description:
Left on a pedestrian path. At night foxes and squirrels come, tear the bags to look for food. A big mess Bags have been here for several days

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12-16, Cookham Crescent, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
